title: Watch: Customer makes mistake of attacking Popeye's employee, catches a side of these hands instead of mashed potatoes
description:
I understand it's easy to get fast food places confused. And there is an ongoing social media debate about Chik-Fil-A vs. Popeye's. Let this video be an explainer. Say you curse at and throw something at the person behind the counter. Chik-Fil-A is where they will pray for you that you have a better day. Popeye's is where they say "okay, it's my turn."

Not them jumping her😭 #hoodfights #fightpage #hoodmemes #streetfights #fightvideos #schoolfights #slumped #viral #trending #explorepage #reactionvideos #roadrage #fighting #fights #girlfights #fistfight #worldstarfight #worldstar #Meme #TikTok pic.twitter.com/TXHVQYCCNW
— TheFightCentral (@TheFightCentral) November 28, 2022

I don't know how many times we have to be over this. Out of all retail workers, fast food workers have the least amount of f*cks to give. The woman behind the counter has no doubt gotten yelled at three times because the order took twelve seconds too long. She's had to clean the bathroom twice because customers are savages. And no, you can't get an extra biscuit.

Also, fast food workers always have backup. How do you know this? YOU SEE THEM BEHIND THE COUNTER.

This is a photo of instant regret. If it had audio, you'd hear a record scratch and Maroon Shorts would narrate: "Yeah, that's me. You're probably wondering how I got into this situation."

And here's the backup I was telling you about. Were they trying to break it up? Were they trying to get their shots in too? Did they start breaking it up, but then things and stuff happened? Honestly, I'm just here for the chaos. I'm also someone who lives his life by the ancient teachings of "don't start none, won't be none."

Whatever led to it popping off, the ladies involved needed to ask themselves if it was worth becoming viral sensations over. Moreso, Maroon Shorts needs to ask herself that. The Popeye's crew held it down.

Editor’s Note

title: Watch: Legendary singer stops concert to remind his audience how terrible Joe Biden is
description:
You youngbloods may not know who Frankie Valli is, but your boomer parents do. There is an above-average chance your dad played "Expression of Love" to work his way into your mother's pants. Or maybe your Pop-Pop did when he was feeling amorous with your MeeMaw. We're not here to talk about your family's mating habits. We're to amplify Frankie taking a shot at Joey. Joey Biden. That f*cking guy.

Valli is so unimpressed with the current resident in the White House, he interrupted his concert to say so.

Frankie Valli stops the concert to share his feelings about Joe Biden!!! pic.twitter.com/JY2uORLpcl
— Dave Rubin (@RubinReport) December 11, 2022
There isn't anybody in this room that couldn't be a better president than what's going on.

Rubin lives in Florida now and I'm not sure if the concert is from there. But if Ron DeSantis was in "this room" when he said it, that would have been awesome.

Valli is most known for singing the theme to the movie Grease. Also, "I Can't Keep My Eyes Off of You" is the joint Heath Ledger sang in 10 Things I Hate About You. Though this is the greatest cover of that song of all time. Yes, it is from a Conor Mcgregor fight. What gave it away?

Since Frankie Valli is trending for taking a shot at Joe Biden, this is the greatest performance of "Can't Take My Eyes off You" of all time. pic.twitter.com/AFQpJg0mAe
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) December 11, 2022

The crowd gave Valli a rousing ovation for his patriotic dissent. It was mostly a room full of olds, and they know what's up. The under-30 crowd is the demographic that still likes Joe Biden. They're the ones dumb enough to think Biden was really going to pay off their student loans. Or not smart enough to understand why the progressive city they can barely afford to live in is so overrun with crime.

In conclusion, "Biden's" the word. It's the word that you heard. It's got derp. And he's failing.

title: Elon Musk slaughters another progressive sacred cow, declares his new preferred anti-Fauci pronouns
description:
At this point, Elon Musk is saying things to mess with people. And you love to see it, because he's not saying things to mess with us. Now that our Chief Twit has gone after Anthony Fauci, the only thing left for him to do is praise the superiority of gas-powered automobiles.

It was a busy day on the bird app with the drop of Twitter Files 4. Side note: while we all appreciate the effort, long-ass Twitter threads should be a privilege, not a right. Just saying to the two dudes, Bari Weiss and least told a compelling story with hers. After the reaction cooled off a bit, Elon started flicking matches again.

pic.twitter.com/80DdvpsNjM
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 10, 2022

Sometimes a meme is just a meme. A funny reference to the Twitter files that have be released. Or, it could be a preview of what's to come. Because his next anti-Fauci meme came out of nowhere.

pic.twitter.com/yhEOieaGER
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 11, 2022

In case Elon wasn't being subtle enough.

My pronouns are Prosecute/Fauci
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 11, 2022

It's important to remember that while we like the cut of Elon's jib this week, that wasn't always the case. Whether or not he's had a change of perspective or is saying things to fire up Twitter because he knows how predictable the left -- and the right -- is... what do I know? I'm only here for the content.

To be clear, I do support vaccines in general & covid vaccines specifically. The science is unequivocal.

In very rare cases, there is an allergic reaction, but this is easily addressed with an EpiPen.
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) April 7, 2021

I am a lot more interested in what happened behind the scenes at Twitter -- and Facebook -- when it came to the past two years of yeeting anyone who spoke against the narrative. The Trump stuff isn't surprising to me. Activist Twitter employees hated Donald Trump. Yoel Roth is a giant jerkface. They wanted to ban Trump for years. J6 gave them an excuse to press the button. Nothing that wasn't expected.

It's J21 up until the day Musk finalized his Twitter purchase -- where the administration was much more blatant about telling Big Tech companies what to do -- that I want to see. The bulk of that revolves around Fauci, his definition of what "The Science" is, and how anyone who contradicted his definition of "The Science" was "visibility filtered." What were the direct conversations with Fauci, the CDC, and/or the Biden administration?

Anything we assumed was happening, the Twitter Files have so far confirmed was happening. Whether or not Musk's sudden digs at Anthony Fauci is a preview of what's to come or nothing more than Elon being a bored on a poop break, that's still to be determined.

Editor’s Note
